abstracts.cdata!:
There is clear evidence that indigenous
            populations have been systematically disadvantaged, namely,
            that by living in poor rural areas, indigenous groups have
            faced limited access to education and health, compared to
            other groups in Ecuador. Interventions for the specific
            benefit of indigenous groups will be incorporated into the
            project design, and, this Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP)
            summarizes specific actions to these efforts. The main
            elements in this plan will focus on: increased level of
            participation of indigenous peoples, and representatives in
            the design of program actions (empowerment); improved rural
            focus of actions (geographic equity); and, tightened
            targeting of measures intended for the poor, so as to
            effectively shift program coverage in their favor
            (interpersonal equity). Regarding education, an improved
            intercultural and bilingual education will be offered,
            enhancing the technical performance of teachers in their
            deliverance of intercultural and bilingual education, with
            specific linkages to other social services to raise
            children's readiness to receive such education. Teacher
            availability will be addressed in the program. Regarding
            health issues, the program will address coverage of the
            uninsured - mostly poor, and indigenous mothers and children
            - through the Rural Social Security services, supported by
            physical and human resources. The program will also address
            social security issues, focused on making a redistribution
            of available social security resources, through improvements
            at the Administration's level, while as a complement to
            the regulatory and administrative reforms in social
            services, an "open access" to information policy
            and support to operational infrastructure, will be developed.
